unnormalised: So, someone asked about the dates of major Indian festivals. It's a bit tricky 'cause many are based on the lunar calendar, right? So the Gregorian dates change every year. Figured I'd give a quick rundown of some of the big ones.

unnormalised: Diwali, the festival of lights, usually falls sometime in Oct or Nov. This yr, 2024, it's expected around Oct 31st. But check a proper Hindu calendar closer to the time, ya? Exact timing can vary slightly depending on the panchangam.

unnormalised: Holi, the festival of colors, is usually in March. Last year, 2023, it was on March 8th. This year, 2024, it fell on March 25th. Always vibrant and chaotic - just the way we like it! Don't forget to prepone your Holi party plans, people.
